description: A common filamentous fungus used in industrial fermentation. It is known for producing citric acid and enzymes such as amylase and protease.
habitat: Aspergillus niger is commonly found in decaying plant material, soil, and food products.
importance: This fungus is widely used in biotechnology, food production, and pharmaceuticals, especially in the production of enzymes and organic acids.
additionalNotes: Aspergillus niger is also known for its ability to cause black mold growth on food and other organic materials, which can be harmful in certain environments.
